Reason: The configuration option 'gc_log_threshold_in_ms' in the Cassandra software project is performance-sensitive because changing its value can significantly impact system performance. This configuration determines the threshold for garbage collection logging, and a lower threshold can increase the frequency of garbage collection events, leading to higher CPU usage and potential performance degradation. On the other hand, a higher threshold may reduce the visibility into garbage collection activities, potentially causing memory issues or performance bottlenecks. Therefore, any change in the 'gc_log_threshold_in_ms' value can have a notable effect on system performance in terms of execution time and memory consumption.
